benchmark_details.name: UNCLE (Uncertainty in Long-form Expressions)
benchmark_details.overview: UNCLE is a benchmark designed to evaluate uncertainty expression in both long- and short-form question answering (QA), bridging short- and long-form QA with paired questions and gold-standard answers.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of a modelâ€™s ability to accurately express uncertainty in both long-form and short-form generation.

data.source: Constructed from Wikidata with key aspects formed for various entities.
data.size: approximately 4,000 long-form QA instances and over 20,000 short-form QA pairs
data.annotation: Manual annotation by authors and verification process.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the accuracy of responses concerning known and unknown aspects.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate better model performance in expressing uncertainty.
methodology.validation: Validated through both automated metrics and human evaluation.
